turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Darling...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Well, if you will excuse me.  Madame. What a pleasure.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: The commissioner is going round the Cafe...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Who does not?

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: If such there breathe, I'm sure you could <u>unearth</u> him...  Your reputation does you honor.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I've left my <u>program</u>...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Take mine.  Ah. And is that your <u>wife</u>...  Signora.  Can it be that you are lovelier, even, than at our last encounter...?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...long overdue.

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Back to <u>America</u>...?   When first we met you'd just returned from America.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I'm not a scholar, Dottore.  But it seemed as if they, as if they...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Yes, I think I amused them.  To what do I owe...?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I require...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: ...yes, yes, yes...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I'd like to walk home with you, and...

turns.speaker: FELL
turns.text: Yes, of course, and we'll <u>collect</u> them. I won't be a minute...

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: ...Franklin.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Where do you live?

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: With Mama and Shirley and Stringbean.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: In and out.  Yes.  And Mama... and Mama, is not your real Mama, is she Franklin?

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: She my foster.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: She's not the first foster that you've had.  <u>Is</u> she?

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Do you like it at your home, Franklin?

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: We got KittyKat...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Yes.... yes...

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: ...and Shirly, let me sleep with her sometime.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Yes.  Franklin, you can't live there anymore.  With Mama and Shirly and Kittykat.  You have to go away.

turns.speaker: FRANKLIN
turns.text: ...who say...?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: The government says.  Mama has lost her job, so she can't be your foster mother.  The police found a marijuana cigarette in your home.  You can't see Mama anymore.  Or Shirley.  Or Kitty Cat.  That's what the <u>Government</u> says...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Make them eat the figurine.

turns.speaker: GENTLEMAN
turns.text: They <u>will</u>, sir.  We <u>train</u> them, to the figurine, <u>eventually</u>, they consume a man, say, 80 kilos, say, in...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: ...tell them...

turns.speaker: GENTLEMAN
turns.text: ...they eat the dummy, sir, they eat the <u>man</u>... I keep them hungry.  When... when do we think this man arrives.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Is it necessary to know?

turns.speaker: GENTLEMAN
turns.text: Well, I don't want to starve them too long.  They die.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Oh, no, no.  It won't be <u>that</u> long.

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: And you let her get away.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Sir, with all due respect....

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: You find something objectionable to working in partnership with....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Sir, I'm in Law Enforcement, I was out there, dealing with an armed and dangerous...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: You were given backup....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: THEN WHERE WAS IT?  I'm sent out there... I'm told that the <u>arrest</u> must be a joint...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: I'm saying: ... and what's wrong with that.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And I'm telling you:  You wanna throw a Birthday Party:  Every kid gets a Chance to Play, that's <u>fine</u>, but...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: No, I don't get you...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Due respect, you <u>don't</u>, sir, your precious Joint Operation.  FBI, ATF, DC SWAT, it's alphabet <u>soup</u>, we don't have the same Radio Freqs, we don't...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Oh, is this your political position, you're opposed to Joint...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm opposed to being part, Your Rainbow Coalition.  Evelda Drumgo?  I could of took her down in a snap of the <u>fingers</u>-- <u>But</u>-- I'm out there, and my Rules of Engagement...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: And, fine, alright, and fine... what are <u>you</u>doing, this whole time?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Sir, I was, as instructed, waiting for the Arrival of the Strike Force. {PAUSE)

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...spend some time on the streets.  Ask me then...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Thank you, that's not responsive.  How did our Miss Drumgo get...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: I came to pay my...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...get outta my way, you sonofa<u>bitch</u>...

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: I realize, you're under a lot of....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: You put my friend in the ground, with your mickeymouse <u>TaskForce</u>...  Izsat the kind of Headlines that Preserve and Promote, you, sir?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...may be the heat....

turns.speaker: KRENDLER
turns.text: Let's get her <u>out</u> of here....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Can you walk?  Are your legs working...?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: <u>Perhaps</u>... shall we <u>see</u>...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm going to cut you loose.  With all due respect, Doctor, if you fuck with me, I'll shoot you dead, do you understand...?  Do right and you'll live through this.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: Spoken like a Protestant.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: You look lovely.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Thank you.  No, I know you'd prefer "I'm glad you <u>find</u> me so..."

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: I'd prefer you to say what you feel.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What is that that smells so wonderful.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: I hope you'll <u>find</u> it so.  Yes.  It's <u>good</u> to see you regaining your strength...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Thanks to <u>you</u>...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...I'm sorry....?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...we were speaking of my <u>father</u>...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: Indeed we were.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...and my need for The Institution...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: Freud, do you know...?  Freud psychoanalyzed patients in One Afternoon.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And how did he do that?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: He saw the truth, and <u>spoke</u> it...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm afraid, this wine is making me woozy...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...you have to <u>eat</u>...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Thank you, Cordell.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...but will that satisfy you?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Why should <u>you</u> care?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: It is not that I care for <u>you</u>--but that I posses an enquiring mind.  What will you <u>do</u> when I am gone?  When you have nothing to occupy your thoughts, save the memory of your own folly, and, more to the point, stupidity.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: ARE YOU <u>DONE</u>?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: <u>Yes</u>.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: You don't wish to <u>beg</u>...?

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: Would that add to your <u>mirth</u>?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Explain in depth the plan we have for him.  Until tomorrow.

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: The girl could use some help.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: You're <u>free</u>...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...which of us is free...?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Yes, to cease to Hope is the Greatest Crime.  The Greatest crime.  Perhaps the <u>only</u> crime.  <u>I</u> never ceased to hope!

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: The girl needs help.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: And what would be of Greater Help, than to release her, from the bonds of this sordid earthly existence.  DON'T YOU THINK?  IN WHICH THE INNOCENT ARE TORTURED IN WAYS WHICH WOULD MAKE THE ANGUISH OF THE DAMNED SEEM TAME AND UNIMAGINATIVE, DON'T YOU <u>THINK</u>?  BLIND HIM AGAIN, AND PREPARE <u>HIM AND HER</u> FOR THE PIGS!

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...might I make a suggestion...?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: ...after you' re dead.  AND WHEN I GIVE THE WORD, do you understand...when I give the <u>word</u>...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: ...when I...

turns.speaker: LECHTER
turns.text: ...what has she done to harm you...?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: You want another drink, honey...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I want the <u>same</u> drink.  Cause it did me <u>good</u>... but I already drunk it, so, barring that, yes, I would like another.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: What's that, Baby?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Alcohol.  Where both its life-enhancing And its life destroying qualities...  ...not unlike some Hindu <u>God</u>...

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: I guess the only thing is Suck it Up...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well.  <u>Excellent</u>... I'm...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Our Mister <u>Frendler</u> to, to, to humiliate me, though....

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: What else's he goin to do with his day, he can't work, and he won't steal...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Oh baby, oh baby....

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Look what they put her on...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No, that is code-word material, that's what <u>that</u> is....

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: You should get Married.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: That's what I should do.  Tell me why?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Because, baby, you're looking to find love in an institution, that's your only chance....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yeah, but who would marry friendless <u>me</u>...  Howabout you, Romeo...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yeah, well, they solved that:  turns out, he'uz a <u>cannibal</u>...

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Show'm the FBI <u>Hand</u>shake...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I am no going to show you the <u>secret</u> <u>handshake</u>!

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Yeah, well, it's a raw wound, innit, you're gonna bump it, every time you turn around... but you know what the <u>trick</u> is...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...not to turn around.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Because you're going to help me plan a party.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: You're going to <u>do</u> that?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm going to do it, and you're going to catch the bouquet.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: The Multi-Jurisdiction Task Force:  read alphabet soup, for the continued pursuit, and in preparation for the apprehension of the fugitive, Evelda Drumgo.  The man's hazing you.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: My daddy would say:  accept with glee the things you cannot change.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: I'll tell you what:  I should go in there, volunteer to fill up his Female Quota.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Mr. Crawford asked my opinion.  Here we've got a purported x-ray, Dr. Lechter's surgery.  Do we keep it secret, or broadcast it?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Saying what, "Look out for a guy with ten fingers...?"

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yeah, that's too Hip for the Room.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: You stay offa this Alphabet Soup Detail, all this half-baked, cowboy stuff, till after you get your <u>mind</u> cleared.... you don't wanna go out there a half-step <u>slow</u>...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I don't wanna go out there at <u>all</u>...

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: What do you want to do?  You want to jam up that sonofabitch Krendler.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No.  I want to buy a dog.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: What broke <u>you</u> free, Girl?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I met a man, and His Troubles Were Greater Than Mine...

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: What was it.  What was it, honey?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...something about my <u>father</u>...?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: ...what?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Do you think you could make a cup of coffee, cause I'm going to work.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: N'not <u>that</u> sad.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Every suicide kills two.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yeah.  Well.  They're a talkative buncha commentators.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: You got a lot of people love you, Starling.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Trouble is, they all seem to <u>die</u>.

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Y'want to gimme Brigham's pistol?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What would you guess, Ardelia?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: You goin to shoot yourself?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Don't shoot yourself.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MAPP
turns.text: Cause I'm tired, cleaning up after you.  Why dontcha gimme the gun?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Give me your gun...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...the purpose of the exercise... is it because they are <u>expensive</u>...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: They aren't expensive, you got them through your connections.... speaking of which:

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Fine, thank you, but

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Speaking of which, I want you also to get us tickets for the Opera...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...whatever is within my <u>power</u>...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: ...and that is what you need to expand.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: We are here on sufferance.  I am here...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...why are we here in the <u>first</u> place...?

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Because it is exclusive... because <u>everyone</u> will be here...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...my love...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: ...they asked us to dinner.  How can we accept if we cannot <u>return</u> the...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I am on the track of...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Yes, yes, yes, your thirty thousand dollars reward, which you would have to split with your team, which, <u>if</u> you get it, will not buy me a new <u>watch</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...what do you expect me to...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: No.  Invite us?  No, he simply...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Then we cannot go.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Because...?

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Because we cannot <u>pay</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: "Because we don't have any money."

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: ....because we don't have any mmm...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: The Case that I am <u>working</u> on...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: It's a <u>joke</u>.  You're a joke.  You're a joke.  You don't know what money <u>is</u>-- your idea of money...  ...spend it on a whore on your 'business trip.'  That is the fine limit of your ambitions...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Ask me when we get home.

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: Oh, my <u>program</u>...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: ...and then, we're going to <u>Greece</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Yes, but the <u>important</u> thing, as I've said...

turns.speaker: MRS. PAZZI
turns.text: ...get me a cigarette.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Hello....?

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: ...what did you want?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I know where he is.

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: I'm sure I don't know who you mean.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I know where he is.

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: And why should we believe you?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I know something no one knows.  He has had his finger removed.  On his left hand.  It left a scar.

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: What shape is the scar?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I want the money.

turns.speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
turns.text: What shape is the scar?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: The shape of a Three.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: An Honor.  Carlo Pazzi....

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No, y'know, I never <u>doubted</u> it...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: You were kind enough, today, to take my photograph.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well, that's you see, what I am, kind and feeling.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Hey, lost again.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: But perhaps, there is some, some less radical solution.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm sure there is, but my young Friend here, would <u>kill</u> you.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: His feelings do him honor.  And I have come, simply, to pay my <u>respects</u> to the great Clarice Starling...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: The great and <u>beautiful</u>...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Is it necessary to say of the sea that it is salt, that the stars are far, that...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No,I get it, this is my <u>Cavalier</u>.  This gents my Italian Knight.  Take <u>this</u>...  For this shall be my gage, and you can take it into battle.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Or clear your windshield with it.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...what a lovely perfume.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Waal, you c'n only get it in one shop in Alexandria Virginia, n'that's where I'm going, cause I'm goin <u>home</u>, f'i can get n'y'one, Of That Nature, to <u>take</u> her there...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...this one is my favorite.  It has not title.  They should call it "fetch," whaddaya think...?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I know it well.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: <u>Do</u> you.  What does that mean?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: It is a gravestone in the cemetery of ______ in my native Florence.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yeah, I'm sure it's famed for lotsa things, and you're one'a'them...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...but:  this particular statue...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Waal, you hold fast to that thought, as I'm sure, that's a "clue"...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ....this is perhaps an inappropriate <u>time</u>... but, I would like to say, it is an honor to meet the Woman who <u>solved</u> the celebrated Hannibal Lechter...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I din't solve it, I didn't '<u>solve it</u>'.  I just sat a <u>dance</u> out with him.  Facts, facts, facts.  <u>Facts</u>, close the case, cavalier.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...a case, so, so <u>fascinating</u>, so...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: What're they on about?

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: They're grilling the applicant for the Vacant Post.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Speaking of the Vacant Post.

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: Dottore Fanelli...

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: ...a Dr. Fell.  A Brazilian, I think. Applying for Fanelli's post.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: Brazilian.

turns.speaker: RICCI
turns.text: It would seem.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...a <u>liaison</u> position...

turns.speaker: SUPERIOR
turns.text: And what does <u>that</u> mean?

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...I feel that...

turns.speaker: SUPERIOR
turns.text: "A liaison position with the Opera."

turns.speaker: SUPERIOR
turns.text: She must be something special After Dark.

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: I can't remember.  I've got to make some money.

turns.speaker: SUPERIOR
turns.text: Thirty thousand dollars reward.  In the whereabouts of Il Dottore Fanelli, or the apprehension of his...

turns.speaker: PAZZI
turns.text: ...yes, yes, yes....

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Tell me why...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I'm sorry, I don't mean to be impolite. Because, you know, you can't understand.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Then tell me.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well, you know, you know, you know, the <u>point</u> is:  I <u>can't</u> tell you.  Cause you haven't <u>been</u> there.  You haven't <u>done it</u>. And that's all there <u>is</u>.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: ...and to have <u>done</u> it, means, can mean to accept, not only <u>danger</u>, but <u>betrayal</u>...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ....that's right.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: ..and <u>humiliation</u>?  What is this new job they've...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No.  That's right.  That's all part of it.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Then, that being so, why is today special?  Why have you come back to see me?  Is it that new file they gave you?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I don't <u>think</u> so.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Then what brings you back?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I don't know.  Do <u>you</u> know...?

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Yes.  I think I <u>do</u>.  I think it is a phrase you used with that woman.  You told her you were an <u>orphan</u>.  You <u>used</u>, to your mind, your most private fears.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: ...you called up memories of your <u>father</u> to...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: ...<u>barter</u> with her.  To appeal to her, and you feel that...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No, I don't <u>think</u> so...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: It is <u>you</u> who have betrayed...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Your father.  It is not <u>they</u>, who...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Well, no...  That's... I appreciate your <u>help</u>, but...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: What does <u>that</u> mean?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I saw a man today, a man so hideously deformed who'll spend his life in a hospital bbb...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Yes, so you said.  But what does that mean:  to go beyond The Institution.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: If <u>he</u> could overcome... his need for... for self-<u>ratification</u>...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: ...would you use a small word?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: For approval.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: What's wrong with approval?  You admired that man.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: How do you think that made him feel?  What does that <u>mean</u>, "to go beyond the institution...?"

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I told that woman I'm an orphan.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: ...you <u>are</u> an orphan.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: But... but....but.... you're <u>right</u>.  I used it.  To <u>bargain</u>.  For her <u>sympathy</u>...  I <u>used</u> it--to "whore myself out"--

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Welcome to the human race.  Do you know, there are people who admire you?  Reasonable people.  Why don't you <u>find</u> them...?

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Yes, but no one is in control of their emotions.  that's all we have time for today...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: You said:  that you have "decided." That your... your feelings of persecution, as you put it are a "self- indulgence," and you are going to put them aside.  And get on with your job.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: And you have decided to accept... to accept this "emotion," as you put it, to the ... the "sweepings. of the Lechter case.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: And you've decided to get <u>married</u>.  You've decided a <u>lot</u> of things.  But, in spite of your decisions--you are still "nagged" by feelings of:  <u>despair</u>, of <u>failure</u> of... you still have the <u>nightmare</u>, you...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: What is your point?

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: That if <u>decision</u> were a useful tool, you wouldn't <u>be</u> here.  Why are you here...?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I want to do something <u>positive</u>...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: You want some <u>advice</u>.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Your life has been defined by institutions.  The Orphanage where you were raised, the FBI Academy, the Bureau.  If the Institution is your life, <u>accept</u> it.  Ask to be reinstated on the "Drumgo" task force.  Play their game.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: ...why?

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: Because it's the game you've chosen. That's really all we have time for.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: He was <u>shot</u>...he was shot.  On his rounds.  And... and...

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: That's when you went to the Orphanage...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And all he <u>left</u> us:  the Country brought back his <u>hat</u>, and his <u>badge</u>... both with a bullethole in them.  An' that's what he left us.  That's what I said.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: And you have been <u>dreaming</u>... dreaming about this Hat, and...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: And.  I always said, he was a <u>P'lice</u> officer.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: But.  He was a night <u>watchman</u>.  That's what he was.  N'They brought back, his hat, his <u>badge</u>, an his <u>timeclock</u>.  N'then they took me off.  I <u>saw</u>... I saw.  Clear as day, do you, do they call it a <u>delusion</u>?  His hat an his badge.  Clear as day, bulletholes and all.

turns.speaker: PSYCHIATRIST
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: But they were not there.  <u>Yesterday</u>.  Is that called a Delusion...?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: For the <u>worst</u> hurt, of course, that which will not heal, is the conviction no one cares.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: I've come to see you, sir, about an Auction...

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Ah, yes, ah yes.  Our Doctor Lechter... And have they sent you, once again to <u>capture</u> him?  How terrible for you...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: No, sir, it's not my job to capt... why do you say how terrible?

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Because we must leave the past <u>in</u> the past.    Ah.  And here we have artifacts of, yes, my own encounter with him...

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Sir, various drawings, done by Dr. Lechter, while in prison, stolen from the prison after his escape, have surfaced and are being sold at auction.  Several large reserve bids have been placed on them.  I have to ask if you've placed those bids.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Because?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Because if it was not you, then, perhaps it was Dr. Lechter, trying to reclaim his own property.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: And why would you suspect me, of this ghoulishness?

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Because, sir, you are the only one of his victims who lived.  And because you have large resources.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Large resources, Starling, which I prefer to devote elsewhere....

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: My encounter.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: <u>Someone</u> offered three million dollars bounty on Dr. Lechter's head.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: Isn't it funny?  You can look on my face  which you would grant me, is the most hideous sight you will see in what I hope is a long life. You can look at me.  Which shows  a Strength which <u>must</u> come from strong  strong convictions.   But you <u>shy</u> when I say the name of God.

turns.speaker: STARLING
turns.text: Yes, then, you're saying that you <u>haven't</u> bid upon these drawings.

turns.speaker: VERGER
turns.text: I have not, I would <u>not</u>.  For life  life goes on Starling.  And, wait, wait, I wish to <u>talk</u> to you... I'm...    One moment.  I was <u>afflicted</u>, do you see, but my affliction was not in my meeting with your Dr. Lechter.  I was <u>afflicted</u> before. Before.  Do you see?  In my arrogance. Do not  Do not curse God when you are humiliated.  Listen to me: <u>embrace</u> it, and you embrace <u>life</u>.... <u>Listen</u>, and you hear the word of <u>God</u>...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Believe me, I wish I knew less.  Oh, if you weren't such a pig...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I can be a good pig. Babe. Charlotte's Web. Good pig. Watch.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Sadist!  I can't believe I thought you could change--This is your idea of discipline?  You're a monster.  That kid is going to be traumatized for...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: About three days. I'm a monster. He's a monster. Actually, we're both just guys. I don't expect you to understand that I...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: No really, keep talking, I ree-ally want to hear what you have to say, you're just so eloquent...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why are you...don't stop...why?

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: "Why?" If I asked questions like that, I'd never make love-"love"-- Damn you, Damn this, damnit!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's funny, when I first met you I thought you were such a weirdo...I still think you're a nut, but you're my nut.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Yeah...Are we going to do it or what? I still haven't packed.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Why are you being so grouchy--This is an important night for us...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Adam. Dollface. We had a physical relationship that served a purpose and now...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But, but that was before we started sharing stuff. Before I told you how I cried when Peepers died. I never told anyone that before.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: And this Peepers was your...dog?  If it makes you feel better, I probably wasn't paying attention.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That doesn't make me feel better! Why are you being like this?

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Don't raise your voice at--I gave you the ultimate male fantasy--sex, nothing on the side. Don't pretend we shared anything other than fluids.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Stop it, stop it, you satanic whore!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You think you're so...but you're just...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: That's it, Adam, pretend it's one of those arcade things, the tighter you squeeze, the more of a man you are...Ooh, that's it.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'm gay. Like you didn't know.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Andrew. You're not gay; you're ten. You shouldn't even be having thoughts like...

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: You mean you didn't have any gay thoughts when you were my age...

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Well, uh...Promise me you won't do anything until you're 18.

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: Did you wait until you were 18?

turns.speaker: ANDREW
turns.text: I'll bet you're glad I waited until the last day to have this conversation.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: You have no idea. Now run away.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Okay, okay, just don't everyone talk at once...First of all, little Jason has a learning disability...

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: Yeah, his lack of intelligence. Sorry, Wendy, but as learning disabilities go, stupidity is often overlooked.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Now what? What did I do this time?

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: I just wanted to know if you've seen this.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Summer would have been a lot less without you. You're a true friend, Donald.

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: Was there a night that I got really drunk and declared that I never loved anyone as much as I loved you?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: That's good. I wouldn't have wanted to embarrass myself.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Pamela Anderson, Kate Moss, Halle Berry, and Fiona Apple, all naked in one room. You can do anything you want to them, except one of them has full-blown Aids, and you don't know who. And you're not allowed to use a condom.

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: Call me conservative, but I'd rub my penis on the faces of all the ladies before bestowing the final honors to the divine Ms. Berry's lovely visage.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Yowza--Only a virgin could answer that fast.

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: I'm not really a--Does it count if...

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: Do you realize if the women of America would have just heard what you said...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: They wouldn't be a bit surprised..

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Make it seem you have this comfortable, mysterious life and you don't give a shit whether she's a part of it. Oh, and bring up India, Talia has this obsession...  Whoa, Donald, play hard to get, not hard to want...Let Talia know that your goofy act is just something you do for the kids....

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: It is?  I don't know about this, Wichita. Am I even right for Talia?                         ] What About Wendy?  I mean, you and                          ] Wendy--how are you and Wendy...                             ] ] WICHITA                                            ] Complicated. Extremely.                                     ] ] Wichita and Donald drift closer toward the head-setted Wendy,         ] who stands to the side of the searchers like a commandant.            ] ] WENDY                                              ] Now remember, people, let's keep                            ] away from the mountain. Repeat...                           ]                                  ] There you are. Could you possibly                           ] do one thing and help keep the                              ] campers away from....                                       ] ] WICHITA                                            ]                                           ] Hey everybody, we're climbing the                           ] mountain!                                                   ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Howdy Pouty.

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: I was pretty confident that I was going to blow it with Talia, but I must say, I outdid myself.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: She's still pissed at me and took it out on you. We should have taken it slower. It's hard to operate in the woods. Much easier in, like a club.  Tell the girl you've got to go do something, leave her view, take way too long until she is worried that you're not coming back. Just as she starts feeling awful, you come up from behind and touch her neck...

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: You are the prince of the darkness.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I'm in the picture on Wendy's wall. Niagara Falls. Family trip. Little Wendy foreground. Me background. What are the odds on that one?

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: Uh, yeah, that's...wow.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I couldn't tell her...it's, it's too major...Jesus, I'm starting to believe in God and what's worse I think I like the guy. The lightning bolt was just a test, right?  Wendy and I--we're meant to be. I'm right, right?  I have to see her...

turns.speaker: DONALD
turns.text: Say Hi for me.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Eavesdropping, eh?  Hear anything good?

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Man, it's not like I don't know about women. I had this babysitter...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: That really sucked, Eric, what you did, asking him that...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Oh thanks, it was nothing...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: You know, I think I left something by the lake. Could you check it out-- You'll know it when you see it...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Sure, Wichita. Whatever you say...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: There you are!  Man, I don't know how to thank...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Eric...You can't be like me. You have to be better. I'm not the guy you think I am...

turns.speaker: ERIC
turns.text: Of course you are. You don't know what I was like before I met you. You're like the best counselor ever.

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: Man, she's losing it...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: It's about time. Isn't Fun great?

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: Talia, don't go!

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Wha-at?  What is it?

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Whew, that wasn't a period. That was an exclamation mark. You know, Hayley, behind every great woman is a great first menstruation anecdote.

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: I hope so...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: This is...this is...a very special moment...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Freeze!  You're busted!

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: What are you gonna do about it?

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Ooh, I'll think of something, missy. A telescope?  Where you going?  I don't want to know.

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: Thanks, Talia...Why are you so nice to me?

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Why am I so--That's new--The way I figure it is if I can get through to just one camper...then I'm a pretty incompetent counselor.                                           ] Don't get caught. I'll deny                                 ] everything.                                                 ]

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Mine!

turns.speaker: HAYLEY
turns.text: You guys have been so colossal...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Go stand by the flagpole.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Sorry about all that...I'm your CIT-- Jasper.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: When all else fails, Jasper--Gum. Even now in these troubled times,                           ] every child's drug of choice.                               ]

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: You are to be executed at Dawn anyway.  Might as well commit the crime. Go to her, Wichita...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: You're all making me blush...

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: No, they're not from Wendy.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Your Secret admirer?

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Not so secret anymore. Don't look all at once...behind the pine...Dorothy from Cabin Seven.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: I guess it was too much to ask that it would somebody older...and maler. Like you.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Hey, I thought I wasn't your type.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Wichita--you're everybody's type. But seriously, don't worry about it. I get my occasional crushes.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Hey, it's not a crush anymore if                            ] you actually say it to the person                           ] you supposedly have the...                                  ] ] JASPER                                             ] Thought I'd get points for a post-                          ] modern approach to coming on to you.                        ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Goodnight, Jasper.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: You're a little harsh on Todd. You're a little harsh on everybody. I know                         ] you like to think of yourself as                            ] the Anti-Oberon, but man, you're                            ] getting just as spooky. What was                            ] that speech in there?  Does Camp really                     ] have to be a revolutionary act?  Can't                      ] the children, at their own pace,                            ] discover...                                                 ] ] WICHITA                                            ] Yeah, okay, I was a little out of                           ] hand, but come on, you got to give me Todd.  Don't get me wrong, I've learned to love the little Piggy, but Todd is the most invincible loser I've ever come across. His greatest talent is lack thereof. No matter                           ] what the category, bet against him                          ] and win.                                                    ]

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Stop, stop...I'm willing to put my mouth where my mouth is...I throw one overhand pass and Todd catches it-- dramatic pause--You let me go down on you...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Hello?!  What's in it for me?

turns.speaker: JASPER
turns.text: Thanks a lot. Seriously though, by winning this bet, you will prove to the world that you indeed know everything.  Isn't the rush of gambling on your cynical philosophy of life enough?

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Are we allowed to start hating "Wendy" yet..."Gee Wichita, I guess mosquitoes have always liked me."

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: You and Wichita go to school together, right?  Have you two ever...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: That would be a No.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: That wants to be a Yes.

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: I don't know what I'm doing. I know he only likes me as a friend. He's just so...everything--I know he only likes me as a--but it came up that he used to be a camp counselor and I used to be a camp counselor...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Get him alone for the summer. Out in the wilderness. Underneath the stars...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Am-ber!  Uh...don't do that.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: "or you're going to get it?" Wow, first week of camp. Promise me you won't try moving so fast with Wichita.

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Don't worry, I have 33 more days to find just the perfect moment to tell him how I...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Don't forget, when you get home, O.B.'s. They're created by a female gynecologist.

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Yeah, an insane female gynecologist! Hayley, don't listen to her.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: They're the easiest to shoplift, okay?  No woman should have to pay for something forced-on-her-without- choice by Nature...what's the matter, Hayley?                                                     ] ] As they playfully bicker, Hayley gazes, with a tinge of               ] longing, to Vanessa and the Bombshellettes parked at a picnic         ] table, flirting up a storm with their cute-boy-counterparts.          ] ] TALIA                                              ] What do you think--it's the Last                            ] Night of Camp Dance.                                        ] ] PIXEL                                              ] What are you saying?  She doesn't need                      ] some <u>boy</u> to validate her summer                             ] experience!                                                 ] ] TALIA                                              ] Oh of course she does, you dumb                             ] bitch.  Just because we're feminist,                        ] doesn't mean we have to be totally                          ] abnormal.                                                   ] ] PIXEL                                              ] Hayley back me up...                                        ] ] HAYLEY                                             ]                                              ] One dance would be kind of                                  ] nice...Don't hate me, Pixel.                                ] ] PIXEL                                              ]                                               ] I don't. Now go away, Talia and I                           ] need to huddle...                                           ]

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Wendy, don't be afraid to get a little stupid and contagious. The kids don't understand that this is our summer, too. We shouldn't have to put our lives on hold to be their butlers.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I just don't know about this whole actual sexuality thing--How do you go from being friends with a guy to wanting to put the thing he uses to go to the bathroom with in your mouth?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: You know you just do this for shock value. It's not shocking.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: When did pretending to be bored become a sign of superiority?  Are you mad at me for giving the cabin new haircuts or are you just still miserably pining for Wichita's lightning rod?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Geez, what time is it?  I have to go feed Big Chief Oberon...You're right, I miss him. Wichita, that is.  I really want to be with him, but I can't bring myself to--Are you a lesbian or are you...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: I didn't realize I had to declare a major.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Why do you even like me?

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: You remind me of me when I was...I guess I was never like you. So cute. So questioning.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I'm not a nai-ive little...

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: You'll be hiding behind a tree.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: The oak where Jocelyn sprained her ankle.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Exactly. When we get into the clearing, I'll turn on my sexy moves. Wichita will go for it or he'll shoot me down.  Either way, you come away with knowledge.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I'm sorry. It just...It seems silly. Like kissing a girl.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: Clever observation. Go back to Wichita.  Oh that's right, you can't.

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: ...sorry...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: This is not the way it was supposed to-- I was going to start writing a children's book using input from all-- I don't even like smoking!

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: One day they'll find a cure for AIDS. They'll never find one for sex. It's kind of funny, most movies and stories with a bunch of camp counselors has some serial psycho in the woods with a chainsaw who systematically butchers everybody one by one.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah. And?

turns.speaker: PIXEL
turns.text: It's just funny...who needs a serial psycho in the woods with a chainsaw when we have ourselves.
